title: Way better than I expected
comment: A long time ago, before Facebook wanted my SMS messages, I backed up an old apk of facebook on a rooted phone. I used that for years before the Messenger merge, when even that old version stopped working. I decided to give Tinfoil a try, worried about lacking notifications and basically using the program in a browser. But Tinfoil has really been a great experience. It's snappier than the browser, has nearly every function the official app has and I feel a lot safer knowing Facebook doesn't have access to every piece of information on my phone.  Unexpectedly, I've actually enjoyed the lack of Facebook notifications on my phone. I feel like I check my phone less frequently and feel less manic/anxious about it. I check Facebook when *I* want to, and get all the notifications then.   Only thing that doesn't work for me is sharing images on Facebook. Comment-photo uploading doesn't work at all, and status-update-photo uploading is pretty broken (on LG G3). But that works fine in the browser, so I just do it there.
Well done

title: Better and safer than the official app
comment: I stopped using the official Facebook app over a year ago, because it was requesting an unreasonable list of permissions, and it didn't offer much beyond what their mobile website offers already.  Instead, I simply started using Chrome for my mobile FB access.  Recently, I discovered this app. It doesn't offer too much over what a bookmark link would do, but I like that Facebook access is sandboxed, and that the page view is full screen without that URL bar that is visible in a regular browser.   It would be wonderful if there was a way to integrate picture sharing to Facebook via the ACTION_SEND intent, but I'm not sure if it's possible to implement with Facebook's mobile website.  Anyway, this is a great app for anyone tired of Facebook snooping in on every aspect of their Internet use.

title: Very good app; Small problem
comment: EDIT: There's a problem with the app setting to open links in a browser instead of in the app.  Even though it is set NOT to open links in the app, it DOES open links in the app, and many web pages don't work when opened in the app.  Please fix.  Adjusted from 5 down to 4 stars pending the fix. Thanks! There is very little different about this app vs using FB in an Android browser.  But the very little differences are what makes it worthwhile, which are the few menu item functions it offers.  It is a good, worthwhile app.  For those of you saying things don't work in Tinfoil on your phones, do those things work properly when using FB in your web browser?  It also became clear from reading the reviews the Tinfoil experience is different in different Android versions, and I'm guessing those differences would also be evident using FB in the web browser.  For those asking for extra features, that would cause Tinfoil to be bigger and heavier and ruin some of its appeal.  For those specifically asking for notifications, simply use the excellent "Notifier Widget for Facebook" app.  Tinfoil  works perfectly on my Incredible and Incredible 2, both running CyanogenMod 7.2.  Thank you!
